a1: Supports objects, arrays, nested structures, strings, numbers, booleans, null values, comments, and inline JSON/arrays.
q2: Can I convert complex nested YAML?
a2: Yes, nested objects and arrays are fully supported in both conversion directions.
a3: JSON output uses 2-space indentation. YAML output uses clean 2-space indentation with proper nesting.
q4: Does it support YAML anchors and aliases?
a4: Basic YAML structures are supported. Advanced features like anchors (&) and aliases (*) may require a full YAML parser.
